author: Bon Jovi
text: It's like a beach blanket and a bottle of wine, it feels something like summertime.

author: Mungo Jerry
text: In the summertime, when the weather is hot, you can stretch right up and touch the sky.

author: Toni Morrison
text: I have only to break into the tightness of a strawberry, and I see summer - its dust and lowering skies.

author: K.D. Lang
text: Sweet, sweet burn of sun and summer wind, and you, my friend, my new fun thing, my summer fling.

author: Anna Godbersen
text: It is easy to forget now, how effervescent and free we all felt that summer.

author: Yukio Mishima
text: Again and again, the cicada's untiring cry pierced the sultry summer air like a needle at work on thick cotton cloth.

author: Jenny Han
text: Everything good, everything magical, happens between the months of June and August.

author: Maud Hart Lovelace
text: It was June, and the world smelled of roses. The sunshine was like powdered gold over the grassy hillside.

author: Benjamin Alire Saenz
text: Summertime. It was a song. It was a season. I wondered if that season would ever live inside me.

author: Evelyn Waugh
text: If it could only be like this always—always summer, always alone, the fruit always ripe.

author: C. Day Lewis
text: Summer has filled her veins with light and her heart is washed with noon.

author: Henry David Thoreau
text: One must maintain a little bit of summer, even in the middle of winter.

author: Katie Lee
text: If summer had one defining scent, it'd definitely be the smell of barbecue.

author: Jack McBrayer
text: I love summertime more than anything else in the world. That is the only thing that gets me through the winter, knowing that summer is going to be there.

author: John Mayer
text: 'Cause a little bit of summer is what the whole year is all about.

author: Bryan Procter
text: Oh, the summer night, has a smile of light, and she sits on a sapphire throne.

author: Henry James
text: Summer afternoon—summer afternoon; to me those have always been the two most beautiful words in the English language.

author: Jenny Uglow
text: We might think we are nurturing our garden, but of course it's our garden that is really nurturing us.

author: Jeanette Walls
text: One benefit of summer was that each day we had more light to read by.

author: Hosea Ballou
text: Tears of joy are like the summer rain drops pierced by sunbeams.

author: Kellie Elmore
text: I love how summer just wraps its arms around you like a warm blanket.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
text: If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
text: Live in the sunshine. Swim in the sea. Drink in the wild air.

author: Van Morrison
text: Smell the sea and feel the sky. Let your soul and spirit fly.

author: Helen Keller
text: Keep your face to the sun and you will never see the shadows.
